page.title: 15AMENITIES
page.content: The area of study contains a wide variety of physical and man_made features, ranging from Bath central district to the rural_urban fringe.The Kennet and Avon canal flows through the area and the river Avon flows westwards towards Bristol and Avonmouth.Flat land,the river flood plain, has been used for building and extensive engineering works ensure that the central area of Bath is now free from flooding. The sports fields provide a change from an otherwise densely built up area and this site (the Recreation Ground _ the home of Bath RFC and County cricket) was also designated for the building of the Sports and Leisure centre.All types of housing are represented, from GEORGIAN to modern flats and apartments. The BATH PRESERVATION TRUST has ensured that the styles conform.
